root_cause_hypothesis: Arcilator enters an infinite loop when processing always_comb blocks with dynamic-indexed array elements that have write-then-read patterns on the same index. The dependency analysis fails to distinguish between different fields (data vs valid) of the same packed struct array element, creating a false combinational loop that the tool cannot resolve.

problematic_constructs.description: Unpacked array containing 8 packed struct elements
Write to struct field via dynamic index
Read from different struct field via same dynamic index
Write-then-read pattern in same always_comb block creates apparent dependency cycle

analysis_notes: Timeout occurs during arcilator processing, not during IR generation or LLVM optimization
The dependency cycle detection code exists but may not handle dynamic array indexing correctly
Packed struct field-level dependency tracking may be missing
Similar issues reported in CIRCT for combinational loop handling
